Alright, for all of you that are having a hard time running this, here's how it should go.  I'm running a dual core processor with an 8800 on XP and these settings work completely.

First off, right click the avp.exe in your Program Files\Fox folder and set the compatibility mode to Win 95.

Launch the game, and for those of us with dual core processors immediately alt tab out and alt ctrl delete.  Select the processes tab and look for avp.exe.  Right click the exe and choose set affinity.  There should be two checkboxes, one for CPU 0 and the other for CPU 1, uncheck CPU 0 and have only CPU 1 checked.

That SHOULD be it, someone said that changing the name of avp.exe worked, so if you have any other problems see if changing that works out for you.  The only problem I have with the game right now is that the text in the menu screens overlay when choosing to save game etc.

Hope this works for you

As for the mounting process it should go

CD 1
Setup Stops
CD 2
Setup Stops Again
CD 1
Install

FIX FOR LOOPING SOUND:

Download Binkw32.dll from dll-files.com and place this in your AVP directory.

The game is said not to work with any GeForce 8 driver.. It has no problems with dual core processors however.

Alright, so I've gotten this to work finally, and thought I'd help out anyone still wondering.

Install the game from the disc 1 setup.exe.

Patch the game to version 1.0.9.6.

Download a crack for said version of the game, then replace the avp2.exe in your game installation (C:\Program Files\Fox\Aliens vs. Predator 2  or whatever) with the crack.

Your game should work flawlessly, without needing to copy the ISO's or whatever to another disc. That, and all of these necessities can be found with a simple google search.

Or, if you'd like, try these:

Patch: http://www.filefront.com/845631/AvP2-Update-1.0.9.6-English/
Crack: http://www.freeinfosociety.com/site.php?postnum=907

Hope this helps you out; I've always liked this game, but I broke my CD.

process:- (i did my processes with magicISO)
1-GO TO THE OPTIONS OF UR MOUNTING DEVISE AND SET LIMIT 2 TWO DISKS
2-MOUNT THE 1ST DISK IN ONE DRIVE 
3-MOUNT THE AUDIO .CCD AND NOT .IMG IN THE 2ND DISK
4-FOLLOW INSTALIZATION PROCESSES
5-ENJOY
